intro: Hedera glomerulata, commonly known as the clustered ivy, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a glossy texture. Hedera glomerulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering display.
